text: Rara National Park is the smallest national park with the area of in Nepal. It was established in 1976. Rara Lake, one of the main lakes in Nepal is in this national park.Bhuju, U. R., Shakya, P. R., Basnet, T. B., Shrestha, S. (2007). Nepal Biodiversity Resource Book. Protected Areas, Ramsar Sites, and World Heritage Sites . International Centre for Integrated Mountain Development, Ministry of Environment, Science and Technology, in cooperation with United Nations Environment Programme, Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific. Kathmandu, Nepal. Around 51 species of mammals and 241 species of birds can be seen in this national park. Around 1071 species of plants can be found in this park. ==References== Category:National parks of Nepal
title: Rara National Park
